business.headline: iValue Infosolutions IPO opens: Should you consider subscribing?iValue Infosolutions plans to Rs 560 crore through an offer-for-sale of 1.87 crore shares. The price band is set at Rs 284–299 per share, with a minimum investment of 50 shares.

ITR refund 2025: How long will it take to reach you?Millions of taxpayers who filed their returns by the September 16 deadline are now waiting for the next big step, i.e., getting their refunds. But how long does it actually take for the money to land in your bank account?

Why gold loans are no longer just a last resort for borrowersGold loans are shedding their emergency-only image, becoming a mainstream credit choice for urban, semi-urban, and rural India, driven by gold prices, regulation, digital access, and flexible borrowing solutions.

Should investors buy IT stocks right now? Here's what Ventura Securities saysVentura Securities warns of a shift, with US-driven risks mounting, domestic sectors like banking and NBFCs offer a safer path, leaving IT investors to weigh growth against growing uncertainty.

Sensex, Nifty rise on US Fed rate cut; Infosys, Wipro gainThe S&P BSE Sensex gained over 350 points to trade above the 83,000 mark, while the NSE Nifty50 crossed 25,400 in early trade. Broader market indices also saw gains, with volatility remaining stable.

DreamFolks crisis explained: What's going on and what it means for investorsFounded in 2013, DreamFolks acted as a platform connecting banks, credit card companies, and passengers to airport lounges, food services, baggage handling, and other airport amenities.

US Fed cuts rates for 1st time this year. Will it give a boost to Dalal Street?Lower US interest rates tend to make emerging markets like India more attractive to foreign portfolio investors (FPIs), as dollar assets lose some shine and Treasury yields ease.

Urban Company shares register bumper debut on Dalal Street, but what's next?Urban Company's shares, issued at Rs 103, opened at Rs 162.25 and surged as much as 74% during the day. For those who got shares in the IPO, that meant instant profits and a near $3 billion market value for the company.

Ben & Jerry's co-founder quits, accuses Unilever of silencing brand's activismBen & Jerry's co-founder Jerry Greenfield has stepped down from the company after 47 years, saying its independence to speak on social issues has been eroded under Unilever's ownership. Unilever, which is spinning off its ice cream business, thanked Greenfield for his service but disagreed with his claims.

IT, defence or PSU banking: Which sector is likely to see growth on D-Street?PSU banking stocks have started gaining attention after a long period of underperformance, while the IT sector remains in a state of uncertainty.

Sensex, Nifty continue winning run amid India-US trade talk optimismThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 313.02 points to close at 82,693.71, while the NSE Nifty50 added 91.25 points to end at 25,330.25. Broader markets also held their ground, with midcap and smallcap indices finishing in the green.

Business leaders extend heartfelt wishes to PM Modi on 75th birthdayProminent business leaders across India as he celebrated his 75th birthday on Tuesday, with several industrialists praising his transformational leadership and unwavering commitment to the nation's progress.

entertainment.headline: Prabhas' next period film Fauji to feature Abhishek Bachchan in key role: ReportActor Prabhas is currently working on 'Fauji', a pre-Independence love story directed by Hanu Raghavapudi. Reports suggest that Abhishek Bachchan has been roped in for a key role in the project.

Exclusive: Son Ye-jin praises Park Chan-wook's eye for awkward momentsSon Ye-jin shares her experience working with Park Chan-wook on 'No Other Choice' in an exclusive interaction with India Today at BIFF. The actor highlights the director's meticulous approach, offering new insights into performance and filmmaking.

Harshvardhan Rane supports Aamir Khan, pledges to bear his own entourage expensesActor Harshvardhan Rane has pledged to pay for his own entourage expenses, supporting producers amid the ongoing debate on soaring star costs in Bollywood. His statement comes after Aamir Khan, Varun Dhawan, and other industry voices raised concerns over the issue.

SRK's adorable photo-op with media, shot by Aryan, wins internetShah Rukh Khan, joined by Gauri Khan, daughter Suhana, and son AbRam, attended the screening of Aryan Khan's debut series 'The B***ds of Bollywood'. Among the many viral moments from the event, one clip of SRK striking poses with the paparazzi has particularly captured attention.

Pawan Kalyan's OG tickets for special show priced at Rs 1,000 in Andhra PradeshThe Andhra Pradesh government has allowed special benefit shows for Pawan Kalyan's 'They Call Him OG' with tickets priced at Rs 1,000. The ticket prices have been increased for both single screens and multiplexes for the first ten days after release.

Exclusive: Lee Byung-hun credits Park Chan-wook's precision for his toughest roleIn an exclusive chat with India Today in Busan, actor Lee Byung-hun opened up about how Park Chan-wook's razor-sharp direction shaped his challenging role in 'No Other Choice'. The film, which had the honour of opening the Busan International Film Festival, also marks Son Ye-jin's much-awaited return to the screen after seven years.

Demon Slayer Infinity Castle storms Indian box office, races past Bollywood hits'Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – Infinity Castle' has taken the Indian box office by storm, earning Rs 51.20 crore in six days and outpacing many Bollywood and Hollywood releases. The movie is currently running in theatres worldwide.

Ranbir-Alia, Madhuri Dixit and celebs shine at The Ba***ds of Bollywood premiereMadhuri Dixit, Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt, and Bollywood's biggest stars lit up The 'Ba***ds of Bollywood' premiere with glamour, style, and star power.

Prime Video renews We Were Liars for a darker, twistier Season 2Prime Video has greenlit a second season of the hit thriller 'We Were Liars', after a debut that enthralled audiences with its intoxicating blend of privilege, secrets, and betrayal. The new chapter promises sharper twists and a darker dive into the Sinclair family's haunting past.

Mirai box office Day 6: Teja Sajja film adds Rs 4.5 crore after Rs 100 crore runTeja Sajja and Manoj Manchu's 'Mirai' added another Rs 4.5 crore nett to the box office collection on Day 6. The film surpassed Rs 100 crore globally within a week.

One last summer: The Summer I Turned Pretty gets its movie finalePrime Video is giving 'The Summer I Turned Pretty' a curtain call – a feature film that will bring the beloved saga to its grand finale, with creator Jenny Han and the original cast stepping back into the spotlight.

Samay Raina wears 'Say no to cruise' T-shirt at The Ba***ds of Bollywood screeningComedian Samay Raina wore a T-shirt with the message 'Say no to cruise' at 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' premiere. The statement is seen as an indirect reference to Aryan Khan's 2021 drug case linked to a cruise party.

Exclusive: Director Park Chan-wook discusses AI, No Other Choice at Busan festDirector Park Chan-wook's latest film, 'No Other Choice' opened at the Busan Film Festival. The filmmaker, in an exclusive interaction with India Today at Busan, talked about the influence of AI and the nuances in his film.

Aryan Khan turns photographer as SRK poses at The B***ds of Bollywood premiereAryan Khan turned photographer for Shah Rukh Khan at 'The B***ds of Bollywood' premiere. Gauri, Suhana and AbRam also arrived for the event.

No Other Choice review: Park Chan-wook film is darkly funny and deeply unsettlingRelease Date:Fri Aug 29, 2025No Other Choice movie review: Park Chan-wook's 'No Other Choice' is a darkly funny film blending satire and family drama. It critiques capitalism's cruelty while delivering a deeply unsettling narrative. It was the opening film at the Busan International Film Festival today.

The Morning Show 4 review: Jennifer-Reese's show remains compulsively watchableRelease Date:Wed Sep 17, 2025The Morning Show season 4 sees Jennifer Aniston and Reese Witherspoon return with fierce performances. The season explores AI's impact on newsrooms and power struggles behind the scenes.

Karnataka government defends Rs 200 ticket cap in court, cites public interestThe Karnataka government defended its Rs 200 cinema ticket cap in court, calling it a public measure, while theatre owners argued it curbs business rights and investments.

Anaconda trailer: Jack Black, Paul Rudd join forces in meta horror reboot'Anaconda' returns to cinemas this Christmas with a mix of action and comedy. The film brings a fresh take on creature chaos featuring actors Jack Black and Paul Rudd in pivotal roles.

Hollywood star Sydney Sweeney offered Rs 530 crore deal for Bollywood debut: ReportAs a testament to her growing popularity in India, Hollywood actor Sydney Sweeney has reportedly been offered a role in a high-budget Bollywood film. The offer includes a paycheck of over Rs 530 crore.

general news.headline: 6,000 voter names deleted in Karnataka's Aland: Rahul Gandhi presents 'proof'Earlier this month, Rahul Gandhi had promised his party would soon drop a "hydrogen bomb" of irrefutable evidence of vote theft. Today's presser wasn't the promised H-bomb, he said at the outset, but it was coming.

Election chief Gyanesh Kumar protecting vote chors: Rahul Gandhi's all-out attackRahul Gandhi urged the poll body chief to stop protecting those "murdering" Indian democracy and challenged him to provide details of the "vote deletions" within a week. The Congress leader claimed that most of the voter deletions occurred in Congress strongholds.

Live: Election Commission to respond to Rahul Gandhi's fresh vote chori chargeRahul Gandhi vote chori press meeting Live: Congress MP and Lok Sabha LoP Rahul Gandhi steps up attack on the Election Commission, alleging large-scale voter deletions through software-driven fraud; presents 'evidence' from Karnataka to back claims. Rahul Gandhi said he would soon come out with a "hydrogen bomb" of revelations about "vote chori".

Will study implications for our national security: India on Pak-Saudi defence pactPakistan and Saudi Arabia have signed a major mutual defence agreement in Riyadh, declaring that any attack on either country will be treated as an attack on both.

A study in calm: Neeraj Chopra's effortless path to the World FinalNeeraj Chopra enters the javelin final at the World Athletics Championships 2025 chasing a third consecutive medal and with the aim of retaining his crown. While Paris redemption, Arshad Nadeem rivalry and retaining his crown adds to the pressure of the final, Neeraj remains quietly confident of a good showing in Tokyo on Thursday, September 18.

Nuclear and Islamic: How Pakistan uses just two cards to tap the ummahPakistan, the only Muslim nuclear-powered country, pitched for an Islamic NATO. It has signed a defence pact with Saudi Arabia, legitimising its nuclear weapons for Riyadh's use if attacked. Pakistan has used just two cards—nuclear and Islamic—to tap the ummah, with the ulterior motive of seeking aid.
Video: BJP MP's terrifying encounter with Uttarakhand landslideThe Rajya Sabha MP shared the chilling video on social media, which shows him standing on a stretch of a road as a hillside collapses.

What is a hydrogen bomb? Not Rahul Gandhi's, the real oneWhile Rahul used the metaphor to describe a political-cum-electoral expose, the phrase has drawn attention to the terrifying reality of the actual hydrogen bomb.

Deepika Padukone exits Kalki part 2: Producers say sequel deserves commitmentDeepika Paudkone will not be a part of director Nag Ashwin's 'Kalki 2898 AD's sequel. Vyjayanthi Movies, the production house, mentioned that a film like 'Kalki' deserves commitment and much more.
The 80% gap: Why most Indians are underinsured and why it's time to actThe solution lies in choosing a comprehensive life cover that reflects modern realities.

University of Bath School of Management: Where Careers Begin With ConfidenceWith students from over 160 countries and a strong alumni network spanning 130 nations, the School creates a community that feels global in reach yet personal in experience.

Pakistan's Asia Cup own goal: When handshake row turned into pointless powerplayIn Dubai, Pakistan's Asia Cup campaign was nearly undone not by cricket but by theatre. A handshake snub against India spiralled into boycott threats and frantic U-turns, leaving players distracted before a must-win clash. The PCB claimed to defend pride, but none of its demands were met.

SRK's adorable photo-op with media, shot by Aryan, wins internetShah Rukh Khan, joined by Gauri Khan, daughter Suhana, and son AbRam, attended the screening of Aryan Khan's debut series 'The B***ds of Bollywood'. Among the many viral moments from the event, one clip of SRK striking poses with the paparazzi has particularly captured attention.

Delhi Police car crushes tea stall vendor, locals claim cops in vehicle were drunkAn unidentified man was killed when a Delhi Police PCR van struck him near Ram Krishna Ashram Metro station. Police are investigating the incident and have promised support for the deceased's family.

Turkish pistols smuggled via Pak drone seized from Disha Patani home shootersThe same Turkish-made Zigana pistol, smuggled into India via drones from Pakistan and cargo routes through Nepal, was earlier used in the killings of gangster Atiq Ahmed and singer Sidhu Moosewala.

The Himalayan Problem: Why bridges and roads fail in the rainsThe Himalayas demand a new ethic of building. It is not enough to construct ambitiously; we must construct wisely and durably. The future of mountain infrastructure rests on two simple but uncompromising essentials: placing it where it belongs, and building it to endure.

Samay Raina wears 'Say no to cruise' T-shirt at The Ba***ds of Bollywood screeningComedian Samay Raina wore a T-shirt with the message 'Say no to cruise' at 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' premiere. The statement is seen as an indirect reference to Aryan Khan's 2021 drug case linked to a cruise party.

Jimmy Kimmel taken off air over Charlie Kirk comments; great news, says TrumpDuring his monologue on Monday night, Jimmy Kimmel criticised Republicans who allegedly sought to politicise Kirk's shooting and took a jab at Trump for behaving like a child mourning his "goldfish" after his ally's murder.

Antifa explained: Trump's terrorist label and the debate around itUS President Donald Trump has officially designated Antifa as a major terrorist organisation. This move intensifies the political battle over protest tactics and free speech in America.

Beyond Yadavs: The Coalition RJD Needs to Reclaim BiharDespite being the single largest party in the 2015 and 2020 polls, the chief minister's post remains out of reach for RJD. The party now faces the challenge of expanding beyond its Muslim-Yadav base to attract non-Yadav OBCs, EBCs, Dalits, and upper castes.

Nigerian man busts 11 myths about being Black in India, opens up on love lifeIn the video, the Nigerian man addressed several preconceived notions that he said many people abroad have about India as he countered them with his personal experiences.

Cloudburst in Uttarakhand's Chamoli, 10 missing, houses washed awayThe incident took place late Wednesday night in Nanda Nagar. While two people were rescued from the debris, search operations are currently underway. A medical team and three ambulances are being rushed to the affected area.

Why gold loans are no longer just a last resort for borrowersGold loans are shedding their emergency-only image, becoming a mainstream credit choice for urban, semi-urban, and rural India, driven by gold prices, regulation, digital access, and flexible borrowing solutions.

Watch: Tamil Nadu cop drives with man on car bonnet after argument, transferredIn Tamil Nadu's Thirunelveli, an argument over a road accident escalated when a police official drove with a commuter on his car bonnet. The incident, captured by bystanders, went viral. He has been transferred pending enquiry.

sports.headline: Yashasvi Jaiswal's white-ball format absence seems like a travesty: Aakash ChopraFormer cricketer Aakash Chopra feels that Yashasvi Jaiswal not being part of India's white-ball setup seems like a travesty. Jaiswal has played just 23 T20Is and one ODI for India during his career so far.

Diego Simeone opens up on altercation with Liverpool fan: Insulted for 90 minutesLiverpool snatched a dramatic 3-2 win over Atletico Madrid with Van Dijk's stoppage-time header. Simeone opened up on constant fan abuse, while Arne Slot urged focus remain on his team's late-game heroics.

PV Sindhu storms past Pornpawee Chochuwong to book quarters berthPV Sindhu stormed into the China Masters Super 750 quarterfinals with a commanding 21-15, 21-15 win over World No.6 Pornpawee Chochuwong, her third last-eight appearance of the year.

A study in calm: Neeraj Chopra's effortless path to the World FinalNeeraj Chopra enters the javelin final at the World Athletics Championships 2025 chasing a third consecutive medal and with the aim of retaining his crown. While Paris redemption, Arshad Nadeem rivalry and retaining his crown adds to the pressure of the final, Neeraj remains quietly confident of a good showing in Tokyo on Thursday, September 18.

Indian football's next chapter: The story of Mohammed AimenYoung star Mohammed Aimen's goals in the AFC U23 Asian Cup qualifiers are a viral sensation, bringing a certain kind of Joga Bonito flair to Indian football. With a senior team call-up, he's a symbol of hope and a glimpse into a brighter future.

Bangladesh pray as Afghanistan, Sri Lanka face off in tense Super 4 raceSri Lanka and Afghanistan face a decisive Group B clash in the Asia Cup 2025, with Bangladesh's Super 4 hopes hinging on the result. Sri Lanka need to avoid a heavy defeat to advance, while Afghanistan must win big to qualify, leaving Bangladesh reliant on a Lankan victory.

Ex-cricketer accuses PCB of corruption: Friends get tenders, players get cheap kitsThe Pakistan cricket board has been slammed by former cricketer Atiq-uz-Zaman for providing the players with poor quality kits at the Asia Cup 2025. The Pakistan players were seen sweating through their kits during the win over the UAE on Wednesday, September 18.

Champions League: Van Dijk's stoppage-time winner for Liverpool spoils Atletico comebackLiverpool snatched a dramatic 3-2 win over Atletico Madrid thanks to Van Dijk's stoppage-time header, keeping Anfield buzzing in their Champions League opener. Bayern and PSG also impressed, with Kane starring for Bayern and the French champions cruising past Atalanta.

Neeraj Chopra at World Athletics Championships: When and where to watch finalNeeraj Chopra will be aiming to defend his crown at the World Athletics Championships 2025 as the javelin throw final is set to take place on Thursday, September 18. With a strong field of competitors, including Pakistan's Arshad Nadeem, all eyes will be on Neeraj in Tokyo.

One-sided India loss left me depressed: Wasim Akram on Pakistan's Asia Cup showWasim Akram admitted Pakistan's one-sided loss to India and their nervy win over UAE left him feeling down. He said technical flaws and underwhelming performances have shaken fans' confidence despite reaching the Super Four.

Neeraj Chopra eyes renewed consistency in World Champs final: Ready to give maximumNeeraj Chopra will aim to rediscover his consistency in the men's javelin final at the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo, looking to end an uneven season on a high with maximum effort and renewed focus.

The Pakistan players were seen sweating through their kits during the win over the UAE on Wednesday, September 18.

Bayern and PSG also impressed, with Kane starring for Bayern and the French champions cruising past Atalanta.

Neeraj Chopra at World Athletics Championships: When and where to watch finalNeeraj Chopra will be aiming to defend his crown at the World Athletics Championships 2025 as the javelin throw final is set to take place on Thursday, September 18. With a strong field of competitors, including Pakistan's Arshad Nadeem, all eyes will be on Neeraj in Tokyo.

He said technical flaws and underwhelming performances have shaken fans' confidence despite reaching the Super Four.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
